metadata.title: Perugu Vada|పెరుగు వడ|చాలా సాఫ్ట్ అండ్ జ్యూసీ పెరుగువడలు ఇలా చేయండి |Dahi vada in Telugu
metadata.description: Learn how to make soft, juicy, and delicious Perugu Vada (Dahi Vada) at home. This recipe ensures perfect texture and taste, ideal for festivals and special occasions. The video provides step-by-step instructions from soaking the dal to the final tempering.

transcription_english: [00:00] Hello Foodies, welcome to Vismai Food.
[00:01] Today's special is Perugu Vada (Dahi Vada). Who doesn't like this?
[00:04] It tastes very very good. Especially for festivals, it's even better. It's very simple but for some, they turn out hard.
[00:10] After a while, they absorb all the water from the curd and remain creamy on top, but not juicy inside.
[00:15] But if you follow our steps, whenever you make them, you will get perfect super soft Perugu Vadas. Let's see how, let's start.
[00:23] First, take one cup, which is a quarter kilo of Urad dal soaked for over four hours, add a little salt and grind it into a fine paste.
[00:31] Adjust the thickness to be as thick as idli batter.
[00:34] Now heat a tablespoon of oil, add a teaspoon of mustard seeds, a teaspoon of cumin seeds, a teaspoon of chana dal, a teaspoon of urad dal and fry just 80%.
[00:46] Then add two chopped dry red chillies, two sprigs of curry leaves, a chopped green chilli, a small piece of chopped ginger, mix well...
[00:54] Add this to a liter of whisked curd, add salt and mix well.
[01:00] The curd should be of flowing consistency.
[01:03] Now pour over a liter of water, add a little salt, two tablespoons of the curd mixture, mix well and keep aside.
[01:13] Now the finely ground batter, look, it should be as loose as idli batter, then you will get soft vadas.
[01:19] Even if the batter is slightly hard, the vadas will turn out hard.
[01:22] Now wet your entire palm, take a small ball of batter, make a hole in the center and fry in hot oil on high flame.
[01:34] These vadas don't need to be fried too red. You can remove them as soon as they turn light golden brown color.
[01:41] Now take these hot fried vadas and drop them into the water prepared earlier and leave them for four to five minutes.
[01:48] Do not squeeze the water at all. They will absorb the water nicely due to the heat.
[01:52] Since the vadas will be a bit soft, arrange them carefully in a bowl after four to five minutes.
[01:57] Then pour the curd mixture and leave it for 30 minutes.
[02:01] That's it, your Perugu Vadas are ready. If you make Perugu Vadas in this method, they will truly turn out very soft.
[02:07] They will absorb the curd nicely and will be very juicy.
[02:10] Even if you keep them in the fridge, the Perugu Vadas won't harden anywhere, they will remain very soft and juicy.
[02:15] Try this method once and see how much you will enjoy. So you also try this method and post that pic on Vismai Food Instagram.
[02:24] Like our Facebook page and let us know in the comment section as well.
[02:27] By the way, Vismai Food is also on Pinterest, follow there too.
